content.data: The CVC database(s) consists of a list of  Cabinets . These Cabinets can be built out of various materials; the material information is stored in the  CxMaterials  file. For each object library in CABINET VISION there is a corresponding .CVC file of the same name.
The following is the breakdown of the tables and their fields:
This table stores general information for all Accessories.

rows: A cross reference to the [Assembly].[AssemblyID] field.
A Boolean value set to true if the accessory is visible, false if the accessory serves as an up charge.
A Boolean value set to true if the accessory has multiple price options.
A flat cost associated with the accessory.
The up charge percent this accessory is to add to a Cabinet or Job.
A Boolean value set to true if the accessory has children, set false if the accessory is only one part.

content.data: A cross reference to the [Assembly].[AssemblyID] field.
A Boolean value set to true if the accessory is visible, false if the accessory serves as an up charge.
A Boolean value set to true if the accessory has multiple price options.
A flat cost associated with the accessory.
The up charge percent this accessory is to add to a Cabinet or Job.
A Boolean value set to true if the accessory has children, set false if the accessory is only one part.
The catalog is a series of assemblies. The Assembly table has a list of all the assemblies.

rows: A unique number to reference this assembly.
A reference number to the main assembly if this object has been cloned. Zero, if the object is a main assembly.

The default height of the object. If the object is saved with the Preserve Size option selected it will come out of the library to the saved size. Otherwise, it will revert to the default height for this object type.
The default width of the object.

The default depth of the object. If the object is saved with the Preserve Size option selected it will come out of the library to the saved size. Otherwise, it will revert to the default depth for this object type.

A Boolean flag if set to true will use this object for automatically filling empty spaces on the wall with objects.
The weight of the object - Used in many stock catalogs for pricing.
The mass of the object - Used in many stock catalogs for pricing.
A Boolean flag if set to true indicates this assembly has additional information in the Accessory table.
A flat cost that is to be associated with the item.

The 0 based index of the character within the assembly’s name that is changeable based on the assembly’s hinging. Its primary use is for single door cabinets, such as, a B9L where the HingeChar would be 2 (L) and Solid would change that character to R if the user changed its hinging from left hinged to right hinged.

content.data: A unique number to reference this assembly.
A reference number to the main assembly if this object has been cloned. Zero, if the object is a main assembly.

The default height of the object. If the object is saved with the Preserve Size option selected it will come out of the library to the saved size. Otherwise, it will revert to the default height for this object type.
The default width of the object.

The default depth of the object. If the object is saved with the Preserve Size option selected it will come out of the library to the saved size. Otherwise, it will revert to the default depth for this object type.

A Boolean flag if set to true will use this object for automatically filling empty spaces on the wall with objects.
The weight of the object - Used in many stock catalogs for pricing.
The mass of the object - Used in many stock catalogs for pricing.
A Boolean flag if set to true indicates this assembly has additional information in the Accessory table.
A flat cost that is to be associated with the item.

The 0 based index of the character within the assembly’s name that is changeable based on the assembly’s hinging. Its primary use is for single door cabinets, such as, a B9L where the HingeChar would be 2 (L) and Solid would change that character to R if the user changed its hinging from left hinged to right hinged.
The Associations table contains information that allows greater flexibility in specifying how stock doors are built and priced.

rows: A long integer value that contains the Door Style ID from the catalog’s Styles table.

A long integer value that contains the Door ID from the catalog’s Styles table BaseID, WallID or DrawerID fields and is the door ID from the door database specified in the catalog’s [Header].[DoorDatabase] field.

A byte value that specifies what this association is: 
 1 = Outside Edge Profile 
 2 = Inside Edge Profile 
 3 = Raised Panel Detail 
 4 = Route Pattern 
 5 = Material 
 6 = Drawer Front 
 7 = Base End Panel 
 8 = Tall End Panel 
 9 = Wall End Panel

A byte value that specifies the door or drawer type this association refers to: 
 1 = Base Door 
 2 = Wall Door 
 3 = Drawer Front 
 4 = Base End Panel 
 5 = Tall End Panel 
 6 = Wall End Panel
A long integer value that specifies the database ID of this associate. It can be the ID of another door, drawer, material or profile.
A text string that is the door, drawer, material or profile name of this associated item.
A double precision float that contains the dollar value of this association (may be zero).
A double precision value that contains the percent up-charge value of this association (may be zero).
A double precision value that contains the maximum allowable drawer height, only applies if this association is a drawer front (may be zero).
A Boolean value that specifies whether this association is available for use or not. Used primarily for internal maintenance.
A boolean value set true if the door catalog cost should be added to the UpCharge

content.data: A long integer value that contains the Door Style ID from the catalog’s Styles table.

A long integer value that contains the Door ID from the catalog’s Styles table BaseID, WallID or DrawerID fields and is the door ID from the door database specified in the catalog’s [Header].[DoorDatabase] field.
A byte value that specifies what this association is:
A byte value that specifies the door or drawer type this association refers to:
A long integer value that specifies the database ID of this associate. It can be the ID of another door, drawer, material or profile.
A text string that is the door, drawer, material or profile name of this associated item.
A double precision float that contains the dollar value of this association (may be zero).
A double precision value that contains the percent up-charge value of this association (may be zero).
A double precision value that contains the maximum allowable drawer height, only applies if this association is a drawer front (may be zero).
A Boolean value that specifies whether this association is available for use or not. Used primarily for internal maintenance.
A boolean value set true if the door catalog cost should be added to the UpCharge
The CatParams table contains any  System Parameters  stored within the Catalog.

rows:
Parameter value type: 
 1 = Measurement 
 2 = Degrees 
 3 = Integer 
 4 = Boolean 
 5 = Decimal 
 6 = Text

Assembly the parameter will be applied to: 
 1 = Job 
 2 = Room 
 3 = Cabinets 
 4 = Base Cabinet 
 5 = Upper Cabinet 
 6 = Tall Cabinet 
 7 = Vanity 
 8 = Closets 
 9 = Closet Standard 
 10 = Closet Horizontal 
 11 = Closet Vertical 
 12 = Catalog

content.data: Assembly the parameter will be applied to:
The Exclusion table contains data that allows the catalog creator to exclude specific options from being applied to a particular assembly.

rows: A long integer value that is the assembly ID to which this exclusion applies.
A long integer value that is the ID of the option to be excluded.

content.data: A long integer value that is the assembly ID to which this exclusion applies.
A long integer value that is the ID of the option to be excluded.
The Header has general settings for this catalog.

rows: An internal reference number used by Solid.
A Boolean flag set to true if the library is configured as a stock catalog.
The internal name of the library.
A number indicating the version of the database. The database version changes each time fields are added / removed from the database.
An internal description of the library.
The default height for a base object. This field is only referenced if Modular is true.
The default depth for a base object. This field is only referenced if Modular is true.
The default height for a wall object. This field is only referenced if Modular is true.
The default depth for a wall object. This field is only referenced if Modular is true.
The default height for a tall object. This field is only referenced if Modular is true.
The default depth for a tall object. This field is only referenced if Modular is true.
The horizontal width of a drawer before the drawer receives two pulls. This field is only referenced if Modular is true.
A Boolean flag set to true if the door style for the base and upper cabinets are to be selected separately. This field is only referenced if Modular is true.
The *.ddb file the doors in this library are referencing. This field is only referenced if Modular is true.

Boolean flag indicating this CVC file is distributable.  When a stock catalog is distributed a copy of the door, material, construction information is placed in the CVC file so that an exact replication of the cabinets can be represented.
Set True to hide list price from the report view

Used to identify the catalog type 
 0 = Unknown (default) 
 1 = Cabinet 
 2 = Closet 
 3 = Decorative 
 4 = Appliance
A boolean value set true if this catalog is password protected
A boolean value set true if the parts for this catalog are hidden
A unique ID used for licensing

The internal name of the library.
A number indicating the version of the database. The database version changes each time fields are added / removed from the database.
An internal description of the library.

The default depth for a base object. This field is only referenced if Modular is true.
The default height for a wall object. This field is only referenced if Modular is true.
The default depth for a wall object. This field is only referenced if Modular is true.

The horizontal width of a drawer before the drawer receives two pulls. This field is only referenced if Modular is true.
A Boolean flag set to true if the door style for the base and upper cabinets are to be selected separately. This field is only referenced if Modular is true.
The *.ddb file the doors in this library are referencing. This field is only referenced if Modular is true.

Boolean flag indicating this CVC file is distributable.  When a stock catalog is distributed a copy of the door, material, construction information is placed in the CVC file so that an exact replication of the cabinets can be represented.
Set True to hide list price from the report view
Used to identify the catalog type
A boolean value set true if this catalog is password protected

A unique ID used for licensing

This table stores the data that appears in the Stock Pricing section of a Catalog. This data can be viewed at either the Bid Center or through the Catalog Editor. It is basically a series of pricing equations that are evaluated in sequence to get the base, list, cost and selling price for each Cabinet in a Stock Catalog.

rows: A unique number to identify the record
The order in which the record will appear and be evaluated in the stock pricing table
The pricing equation for this line item.  Equation can consist of raw numbers, job totals, variables, previous line numbers and options
A short unique string to identify the purpose of the record
A Boolean flag indicating that the record was created by the system.  These formulas can not be modified by either the manufacturer of the dealer
A Boolean flag indicating that the record was created by the manufacturer.  These items can only be modified from the catalog editor
A Boolean flag indicating if this record Reference and Result of Formula should appear in the bid center as a price total.  Here the manufacturer or the dealer can decide what data is displayed

A Boolean flag indicating in the record should be evaluated for each cabinet or only once per job.  As an example… If you had a 20 cabinet job and the formula was simply 100 and PerJob = $100 -- Not PerJob = $2,000 ($100 x 20 cabinets)
A Boolean flag indicating if this record should appear for an individual cabinet breakout in the bid center.
A Boolean flag indicating if this record should appear for an individual accessory breakout in the bid center.

content.data: A unique number to identify the record
The order in which the record will appear and be evaluated in the stock pricing table
The pricing equation for this line item.  Equation can consist of raw numbers, job totals, variables, previous line numbers and options
A short unique string to identify the purpose of the record
A Boolean flag indicating that the record was created by the system.  These formulas can not be modified by either the manufacturer of the dealer
A Boolean flag indicating that the record was created by the manufacturer.  These items can only be modified from the catalog editor
A Boolean flag indicating if this record Reference and Result of Formula should appear in the bid center as a price total.  Here the manufacturer or the dealer can decide what data is displayed

A Boolean flag indicating in the record should be evaluated for each cabinet or only once per job.  As an example… If you had a 20 cabinet job and the formula was simply 100 and PerJob = $100 -- Not PerJob = $2,000 ($100 x 20 cabinets)
A Boolean flag indicating if this record should appear for an individual cabinet breakout in the bid center.
A Boolean flag indicating if this record should appear for an individual accessory breakout in the bid center.
The ListPrices table stores the price(s) for each assembly, one price for each of the price labels.

rows: A unique number to reference the price.
A cross reference to the [Assembly].[AssemblyID] field.
A cross reference to the [PriceLabel].[PriceID] field.
The cost of the assembly for that price label.

content.data: A unique number to reference the price.
A cross reference to the [Assembly].[AssemblyID] field.
A cross reference to the [PriceLabel].[PriceID] field.
The cost of the assembly for that price label.
This table stores the order the objects will appear in the select window.

rows: A unique number for referencing the menu.
A reference to another [MenuID] that points to the menu's parent. If set to 0 this menu appears when the library is first selected.
The sort order for a group of menus.
Reference to the bitmap displayed in the select window.
The text displayed in the select window.
A reference to the [Assembly].[AssemblyID] field. The assembly this menu references. If Action is 0 or 1 this will be set to 0.
A Boolean flag if set to true will not allow the menu item to be deleted within the program.

content.data: A unique number for referencing the menu.
A reference to another [MenuID] that points to the menu's parent. If set to 0 this menu appears when the library is first selected.
The sort order for a group of menus.
Reference to the bitmap displayed in the select window.
The text displayed in the select window.
A reference to the [Assembly].[AssemblyID] field. The assembly this menu references. If Action is 0 or 1 this will be set to 0.
A Boolean flag if set to true will not allow the menu item to be deleted within the program.

Used with Stock Catalogs only. The items (Oak, Maple, Birch, etc) for an option (Wood Species) are listed in the Options table. If the selected option effects the construction or materials for the job, that data is stored in the OptionEffect table.

rows: A unique number to reference this option group.

Indicates what area of Construction the option will effect: 
 1 = Construction 
 2 = Material 
 3 = Finish 
 4 = Modification 
 5 = Exposed Interior 
 6 = UCS 
 7 = Out Side Edge Detail 
 8 = Inside Edge Detail 
 9 = Raised panel Detail 
 10 = Route Pattern 
 11 = Frame Bead

Used in conjunction with Type to indicate what area of Construction the option will effect: 
 1 = Cabinet 
 10 = Counter Top 
 13 = Drawer Box 
 14 = Roll Out 
 15 = Colors 
 16 = Room 
 17 = Doors 
 18 = Drawer Fronts 
 19 = Pulls 
 20 = Hinges 
 21 = Drawer Guides 
 22 = Molding
The value that should be set for the item the type and param are pointing to

content.data: A unique number to reference this option group.
Indicates what area of Construction the option will effect:
Used in conjunction with Type to indicate what area of Construction the option will effect:
The value that should be set for the item the type and param are pointing to
Stock catalogs typically offer various options for cabinets. Two of these options might be Wood Species & Drawer Style. These option groups are listed in the OptionLables table.

rows: A unique number to reference this option group.
A Boolean flag set true if the option needs to be selected when an object is selected from the library. If set false the option is displayed in the bid program.
A Boolean flag set true if the option is setup by the manufacturer and can not be modified.
A Boolean value indicating if the option can be changed per cabinet.  If set to true then this item will appear in the option list when you right click on a cabinet and select properties
The order in which the options will be displayed

content.data: A unique number to reference this option group.
A Boolean flag set true if the option needs to be selected when an object is selected from the library. If set false the option is displayed in the bid program.
A Boolean flag set true if the option is setup by the manufacturer and can not be modified.
A Boolean value indicating if the option can be changed per cabinet.  If set to true then this item will appear in the option list when you right click on a cabinet and select properties
The order in which the options will be displayed

rows: A unique number used to reference the option.
A short name for the option.
The percent of profit to be applied to the up-charge.
The order in which the option will be displayed

content.data: A unique number used to reference the option.
A short name for the option.
The percent of profit to be applied to the up-charge.
The order in which the option will be displayed
Multiple assemblies can share the same parameters these values are stored in the Parameters table. The assemblies consist of a group of Parts.

rows: A cross reference to the [Assembly].[AssemblyID] field
An identifier used to cross reference prices from other stock catalogs for similar cabinets. The signature is comprised of the cabinet type, end types, and sectioning information.

A delimited string of saved parameters for this assembly. Each parameter begins with an "=" followed by the parameter name, the value for the parameter is proceeded with a # symbol then delimited by a carriage return.
A cross reference to the [Shapes].[ShapeID] field. If this value is a negative number, it is referencing one of the predefined system shapes.

Used exclusively for stock catalog pricing. The number of additional doors to add to a cabinet. The doors are not visible, this field is utilized for stock catalogs that setup false door/drawer counts for their pricing structure.

When you save an object into the library, you have the option to preserve construction and material information. This data is stored in the Preserves table.

rows: A cross reference to the [Assembly].[AssemblyID] field.
A Boolean flag set to true if the object is a top level assembly.

A numeric value indicating what type of item is being preserved: 
 1 = Material 
 2 = Material Schedule 
 3 = Cabinet Construction 
 4 = Drawer Box 
 5 = Roll Out 
 6 = Door

Object identifier: 
 Type=1([tbl Parts].[ID] from Material.cvm) 
 Type=2([tbl Schedules].[ID] from Material.cvm) 
 Type=3([Cabinets].[ID] from Wiz_Data.wdb) 
 Type=4 or 5([tblDrawers].[DrawerID] from Wiz_Data.wdb) 
 Type=6([Doors].[ID] from Door database)

The Material ID: 
 If Type = 1 then the [tbl Material].[ID] from Material.cvm 
 If Type = 6 then the [tbl schedules].[ID] from Material.cvm 
 If Type = 2 - 5 then 0.

If Type = 1 then the [tbl Finishes].[ID] for the part's face. 
 If Type = 6 then a cross reference to the [Profile].[ID] field in the Door Database.

If Type = 1 then the [tbl Finishes].[ID] for the part's back. 
 If Type = 6 then a cross reference to the [Profile].[ID] field in the Door Database.

If Type = 1 then the [tbl Finishes].[ID] for the part's edge. 
 If Type = 6 then a cross reference to the [Profile].[ID] field in the Door Database.

If Type = 1 then the [tbl Finishes].[ID] for the part's end. 
 If Type = 6 then a cross reference to the [Profile].[ID] field in the Door Database.

If Type = 6 then the door class: 
 1= Base 
 2 = Upper 
 3 = Drawer 
 4 = Base End 
 5 = Wall End 
 6 = Tall End

content.data: A cross reference to the [Assembly].[AssemblyID] field.
A Boolean flag set to true if the object is a top level assembly.
A numeric value indicating what type of item is being preserved:
If Type = 1 then the [tbl Material].[ID] from Material.cvm
If Type = 6 then the [tbl schedules].[ID] from Material.cvm
If Type = 1 then the [tbl Finishes].[ID] for the part's face.
If Type = 6 then a cross reference to the [Profile].[ID] field in the Door Database.
If Type = 1 then the [tbl Finishes].[ID] for the part's back.
If Type = 6 then a cross reference to the [Profile].[ID] field in the Door Database.
If Type = 1 then the [tbl Finishes].[ID] for the part's edge.
If Type = 6 then a cross reference to the [Profile].[ID] field in the Door Database.
If Type = 1 then the [tbl Finishes].[ID] for the part's end.
If Type = 6 then a cross reference to the [Profile].[ID] field in the Door Database.
If Type = 6 then the door class:
Stock catalogs typically have "column pricing" this means one object can have different prices based on the door style and job options. The column pricing headers are listed in the PriceLabels table.

rows: A unique number to reference the price label.
The title of the price label.
The order in which the price label is to be displayed

content.data: A unique number to reference the price label.
The title of the price label.
The order in which the price label is to be displayed
This stores any CAD Overlays saved with the Assembly.

rows: A cross-reference to the [Assembly].[AssemblyID] or the [Parts].[PartID] that indicates what object this scene is linked to.
A boolean value set true if the ParentID is linked to the Parts table
The order in which the price label is to be displayed

A series of bit flags indicating the Scene's attributes: 
 Axis (2 Bits) 0 =Unknown, 1=XY, 2=XZ, 3=ZY 
 Level (3 Bits) 0 = Unknown, 1=Layout, 2=Cabinet, 3=Part, 4=Drawing 
 0x020  Overlay, 0x040 Used, 0x080 Lock, 0x100 Modified, 0x200 Explode, 0x400 Hide
The default top limit of the Scene.
The default right limit of the Scene.
The default bottom limit of the Scene.
The number of objects in the Scene.
A block of binary data containing the CAD objects

content.data: A cross-reference to the [Assembly].[AssemblyID] or the [Parts].[PartID] that indicates what object this scene is linked to.
A boolean value set true if the ParentID is linked to the Parts table
The order in which the price label is to be displayed
A series of bit flags indicating the Scene's attributes:
0x020  Overlay, 0x040 Used, 0x080 Lock, 0x100 Modified, 0x200 Explode, 0x400 Hide
The default top limit of the Scene.
The default right limit of the Scene.
The default bottom limit of the Scene.
The number of objects in the Scene.
A block of binary data containing the CAD objects
Any unique shapes for either parts or assemblies are stored in the Shapes table.

rows: A unique number to reference the shape.
A cross reference to the ShapeID field if this shape has a parent.
The number of coordinates in this shape.
The number of faces in this shape.
The width of the bounding box of the shape.
The height of the bounding box of the shape.
The depth of the bounding box of the shape.
A series of bit flags for the shape.
An internal count of how many times the shape is being referenced by a part or assembly.
A block of binary data containing coordinate information.
A block of binary data containing face information.

content.data: A unique number to reference the shape.
A cross reference to the ShapeID field if this shape has a parent.
The number of coordinates in this shape.
The number of faces in this shape.
The width of the bounding box of the shape.
The height of the bounding box of the shape.
The depth of the bounding box of the shape.
A series of bit flags for the shape.
An internal count of how many times the shape is being referenced by a part or assembly.
A block of binary data containing coordinate information.
A block of binary data containing face information.
There can be multiple door styles pointing to the same price label. The door styles are described in the Styles table.

rows: A unique number to reference the style.
A cross reference to the [Doors].[ID] field in the Door Database, indicating the Door Style.
A cross reference to the [tbl Schedules].[ID] field in Material.cvm, indicating the Door Material.
A cross reference to the [Profiles].[ID] field in the Door Database indicating the selected Profile.
An up-charge amount associated with Door Style.
An up-charge percent associated with this Door Style.
A cross-reference to the [PriceLabel].[PriceID] field. When this Door Style is selected, it will use the prices associated with this price label.
This field is no longer used see [Exclusions].[MaxHeight].
The order in which the style is to be displayed

content.data: A unique number to reference the style.
A cross reference to the [Doors].[ID] field in the Door Database, indicating the Door Style.
A cross reference to the [tbl Schedules].[ID] field in Material.cvm, indicating the Door Material.
A cross reference to the [Profiles].[ID] field in the Door Database indicating the selected Profile.
An up-charge amount associated with Door Style.
An up-charge percent associated with this Door Style.
A cross-reference to the [PriceLabel].[PriceID] field. When this Door Style is selected, it will use the prices associated with this price label.
This field is no longer used see [Exclusions].[MaxHeight].
The order in which the style is to be displayed
This table stores a list of variables that can be used in the pricing formulas found in LinePricing.

rows: A unique number to identify the record
A short unique string to identify the variable
The default value the variable should represent
A Boolean flag indicating that the record was created by the system.  These items can not be modified by either the manufacturer of the dealer
A Boolean flag indicating that the record was created by the manufacturer.  These items can only be modified from the catalog editor

content.data: A unique number to identify the record
A short unique string to identify the variable
The default value the variable should represent
A Boolean flag indicating that the record was created by the system.  These items can not be modified by either the manufacturer of the dealer
A Boolean flag indicating that the record was created by the manufacturer.  These items can only be modified from the catalog editor
